topic.title: Sent Items Folder
topic.p: The Sent Items folder stores copies of outgoing messages.
By default, Webmail does not automatically save copies of sent messages in your Sent Items folder.

ol.title: To enable this option for a single message:
ol.li:
After you compose your message, select the Save a copy to Sent Items folder check box.
Note: Be aware that attachments also are saved and that they affect your account disk space.
Click Send. After a short pause, the Inbox window appears with a message informing you that your message was sent.

ol.title: To automatically save all sent messages in the Sent Items folder:

li.p: In the Webmail Options menu group, click Outgoing Mail (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary).
The Outgoing Mail Options window appears.

ol.li:
Next to Save Sent Mail, select Yes, save a copy of all sent mail in the Sent Items folder.
Note: Be aware that attachments also are saved and that they affect your account disk space.
Click Save. A message appears informing you that your changes have been saved. Copies of all future sent messages will be saved in the Sent Items folder.

ul.title: From the Sent Items folder, you can perform the following tasks:
ul.li: Display email messages on other pages in this folder (if you have limited how many messages can appear on one page).
